name: Number and Numeration
description: This foundational section covers the basic properties and operations of numbers. It includes number bases, fractions, decimals, percentages, indices, logarithms, surds, and the fundamentals of set theory. Mastery of this section is a prerequisite for all other areas of mathematics.
subject: Mathematics

name: Algebra
description: Building on Number and Numeration, this section deals with symbolic representation and manipulation. Key topics include polynomials, variations, inequalities, progressions (sequences and series), binary operations, and matrices. It provides the tools for solving equations and understanding relationships.
subject: Mathematics

name: Geometry and Trigonometry
description: This section explores the properties of shapes, spaces, and the relationships between angles and lengths. It covers Euclidean geometry, area and volume calculations (mensuration), loci, coordinate geometry (linking algebra and geometry), and trigonometry.
subject: Mathematics
prerequisite_topics: Perimeters and areas of plane figures
Surface areas and volumes of solids
Midpoint and gradient of a line

name: Calculus
description: Requiring a strong foundation in Algebra and Geometry, Calculus is the study of continuous change. This introductory section covers the core concepts of differentiation to find rates of change and maxima/minima, and integration to calculate the area under curves.
subject: Mathematics
prerequisite_topics: Application of differentiation to rates of change

name: Statistics and Probability
description: This section focuses on data analysis, interpretation, and prediction. It includes data representation (charts and graphs), measures of location (mean, median, mode), measures of dispersion (range, variance), permutations, combinations, and the fundamental principles of probability.
subject: Mathematics
